intro: Tambourissa vestita, commonly known as the naked tambourissa, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its smooth, hairless stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. Its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers are typically yellow or orange, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and adaptability to various soil types.
